page.title: 01SW.Cheshire near Saighton.
page.content: This lowland, rural area,dotted with ponds,is south-east of Chester.The village of Saighton in its N.W. corner is 4 miles from Chester.It is largely a pleasant,quiet, agricultural area with grassland for dairy cattle but there is also some production of other crops.About a third of the land is owned by Gerald Grosvenor,6th Duke of Westminster,with Lord Woolley and his family having another sixth. The settlement generally is in the form of scattered farmhouses but a line of settlement does follow the route of the A 41(T) road,which nearly bissects the area and there is also the concentration in Saighton.Many buildings are 19th century & some are listed. Various small businesses are dispersed throughout the area and not all of them are connected with agriculture.
